questions.question_text: Jene potānu kalyāṇ ichchhavu tene to _____ ne _____ ethī uparānt bīju kāī jagatmā sukhdāyī nathī.
questions.explanation: According to Vachanamrut Gadhada Antya 7, for those who wish for their own liberation, there is nothing more beneficial in this world than God and God's holy Sadhu.

questions.question_text: “...amāro draḍh vishvās rākhasho ne kahīe tem karasho to tamane mahākaṣhṭ koīk āvī paḍashe tethī athavā sāt dakālī jevu paḍashe te thakī rakṣhā karashu ane koī ūgaryāno āro na hoy evu kaṣhṭ āvī paḍashe toy paṇ rakṣhā karashu.”
questions.explanation: This quotation is from Vachanamrut Jetalpur 5.

questions.question_text: "Atishay je Moṭā Puruṣh hoy teno je upar _____ thāy tenā game tevā malin sanskār hoy to nāsh pāme ane Moṭā Puruṣhno rājīpo thayo hoy to rānk hoy te rājā thāy."
questions.explanation: This quote highlights the power of the pleasure of the great Purush.

questions.question_text: “Jene potānu kalyāṇ ichchhavu tene to Bhagwān ne Bhagwānnā sādhu ethī uparānt bīju kāī jagatmā sukhdāyī nathī.”
questions.explanation: This is a quote from Vachanamrut Gadhada Antya 7.

questions.question_text: “...jene māhātmye sahit nishchay hoy tene em samajāy je, ‘Je divase Bhagwānnu darshan thayu te divasthī ja _____ to thaī rahyu chhe...’
questions.explanation: This quote discusses the certainty of salvation upon having darshan of Bhagwan.

questions.question_text: “...jene māhātmye sahit nishchay hoy tene em samajāy je, ‘Je divase Bhagwānnu darshan thayu te divasthī ja kalyāṇ to thaī rahyu chhe ane je jīv bhāve karīne māru darshan kare tathā māru vachan māne tenu paṇ kalyāṇ thaī jāy to māre kalyāṇno shyo sanshay chhe? Hu to kṛutārth chhu ane je kāī sādhan karu chhu te to Bhagwānnī prasannatāne arthe karu chhu,’ em samaje tene Bhagwānno māhātmye sahit nishchay jāṇavo.”
questions.explanation: The long quote is from Vachanamrut Gadhada Pratham 72.

questions.question_text: "Atishay je Moṭā Puruṣh hoy teno je upar rājīpo thāy tenā game tevā malin sanskār hoy to nāsh pāme ane Moṭā Puruṣhno rājīpo thayo hoy to rānk hoy te _____ thāy."
questions.explanation: This quote talks about how one can become a king through the raji of the great Purush.

questions.question_text: “Jene pratyakṣh pramāṇ draḍh āsharo hoy tene manmā evī bīk na rākhavī je, ‘Hu rakhe marīne bhūt-pret thau ke rakhe Indralokne ja pāmu ke rakhe Brahmalokne ja pāmu!’ Evī āshankā manmā rākhavī nahī; kem je, je evo Bhagwānno bhakta hoy te to Bhagwānnā dhāmne ja pāme paṇ vachmā kyāy tene Bhagwān rahevā de nahī.”
questions.explanation: This quotation comes from Vachanamrut Gadhada Antya 7.

questions.question_text: “...amāro draḍh vishvās rākhasho ne kahīe tem karasho to tamane _____ koīk āvī paḍashe tethī athavā sāt dakālī jevu paḍashe te thakī rakṣhā karashu ane koī ūgaryāno āro na hoy evu kaṣhṭ āvī paḍashe toy paṇ rakṣhā karashu.”
questions.explanation: This is a quote where Maharaj says if you keep faith in him, he will protect you even if a great calamity falls upon you.

questions.question_text: “Jene pratyakṣh pramāṇ draḍh āsharo hoy tene manmā evī bīk na rākhavī je, ‘Hu rakhe marīne _____ thau ke rakhe Indralokne ja pāmu ke rakhe Brahmalokne ja pāmu!’
questions.explanation: This quote from Vachanamrut Gadhada Antya 7 says one should not fear that one will become a ghost after death.
